whatIs.title: What is Aperto?
whatIs.p1: Aperto is an open-source Bible translation project written for modern readers—whether you're a lifelong believer wanting fresh eyes on familiar texts, or a sceptic curious what these ancient texts actually say.
whatIs.p2: The name comes from Latin 'apertus': open, accessible, unconcealed. It's inspired by Luke 24:32, where the disciples say their hearts burned within them as Jesus opened the Scriptures to them.

philosophy.title: Our Philosophy
philosophy.believerSkepticDesc: We write for both—people deeply rooted in faith seeking fresh perspective, and people exploring from the outside. Whether you've spent your whole life in church or never stepped inside one, you're welcome here.
philosophy.ecumenicalDesc: Our approach integrates Catholic, Orthodox, Protestant, and Pentecostal scholarship fairly—not flattened into one tradition. We also engage with feminist, liberationist, and historical-critical readings, aware of how translations have historically been used to both liberate and harm.
philosophy.accessibleDesc: Contemporary language that reads like modern literature. No religious jargon, no insider vocabulary—just the text, alive and direct. Honest footnotes that make complexity accessible rather than hidden.
philosophy.multimediaDesc: Audio Bible, podcasts, original songs, and contemplative practices. Meeting people where they are, not just where they ought to be.
philosophy.openSourceDesc: CC BY-SA 4.0 licence. Everything—translation, exegesis, songs—is free to use, adapt, and build upon. Because Scripture belongs to everyone.

team.title: The Team
team.description: Aperto is a community project based in Berlin. We're translators, musicians, designers, and developers committed to making Scripture accessible to everyone.

overview.title: Overview
overview.p1: Aperto uses an AI-assisted approach to Bible translation—not to replace human judgement, but to amplify it. We believe combining cutting-edge technology with human insight can help make Scripture accessible to new audiences.
overview.p2: Every translation decision goes through multiple layers of review, combining AI drafts with human expertise, community feedback, and ongoing revision.

theological.title: A Theological Justification
theological.p1: When Jesus said 'I tell you, if these were silent, the very stones would cry out' (Luke 19:40), he was responding to religious leaders who wanted to silence the proclamation of who he was. His point: if the expected voices fall silent, God will use unexpected means.
theological.p2: We don't claim AI is literally the 'stones crying out'. But we do believe that when traditional gatekeepers can't or won't make Scripture accessible to everyone, God's message will find other ways through.
theological.p3: There's a certain poetry to it: silicon chips are, after all, rocks we taught to think. Sand refined, etched with circuits, trained on humanity's collected wisdom. If God can speak through a burning bush, a donkey, or bread and wine—perhaps silicon isn't so strange a medium.
theological.poetry: Silicon chips are rocks we taught to think. Sand refined, etched with circuits, trained on humanity's collected wisdom.
theological.p4: The printing press was once viewed with suspicion by religious authorities. So was translating the Bible into vernacular languages. Every technological shift that democratised access to Scripture was initially resisted—and eventually embraced.

step1.title: Deep Exegesis
step1.desc: Comprehensive scholarly research: Greek text analysis, major commentaries, lexicons, cultural studies, and patristic sources.

step2.title: Translation Draft
step2.desc: AI-assisted draft generation, filtered through our translation philosophy: accessible, literary, honest.

step3.title: Footnotes
step3.desc: Cultural context, Greek word choices, scholarly debates, and honest acknowledgement of difficult passages.

step4.title: Multimedia Production
step4.desc: Audio Bible, discussion podcasts, original songs, and contemplative practices.

step5.title: Human Review
step5.desc: Every translation passes through human review. AI generates drafts; humans refine, correct, and approve.

step6.title: Community Feedback
step6.desc: Ongoing revision based on reader feedback and scholarly insights.

clarity.title: Clarity
clarity.desc: Every sentence should be understandable without assuming religious background.

faithfulness.title: Faithfulness
faithfulness.desc: Preserving the meaning of the original whilst expressing it in natural, contemporary English.

beauty.title: Beauty
beauty.desc: Language worthy of being read—not just information, but literature.

humility.title: Humility
humility.desc: Honest acknowledgement of uncertainty, different interpretations, and our own limitations.

invitation.title: Get Involved
invitation.desc: This is an open project. We welcome contributions—translation help, cultural consultation, audio production, or technical development.

privacy.title: Privacy Policy
privacy.intro: The Aperto Bible Project is committed to protecting your privacy. This policy explains how we handle your data.

dataCollection.title: Data Collection
dataCollection.text: This website does not collect personal data. We do not use cookies for tracking, and we do not use analytics services that track individual users.

hosting.title: Hosting
hosting.text: This website is hosted on GitHub Pages. GitHub may collect technical information such as IP addresses for security and operational purposes. Please refer to GitHub's privacy policy for details.

contact.title: Contact
contact.text: For privacy-related questions, please contact us at info@apertobible.com.

rights.title: Your Rights
rights.text: Under GDPR, you have the right to access, rectify, or delete any personal data we may hold about you. Since we don't collect personal data, this is unlikely to apply, but we're happy to respond to any enquiries.

accessibility.title: Accessibility Statement
accessibility.intro: The Aperto Bible Project is committed to making our content accessible to everyone, including people with disabilities.

standards.title: Accessibility Standards
standards.text: We aim to conform to WCAG 2.1 Level AA guidelines. Our website is designed with semantic HTML, keyboard navigation support, and appropriate colour contrast.

features.title: Accessibility Features
list: Semantic HTML structure for screen reader compatibility
Keyboard navigation support throughout the site
Responsive design that works across devices

feedback.title: Feedback
feedback.text: We welcome feedback on accessibility. If you encounter barriers or have suggestions for improvement, please contact us at info@apertobible.com.

ongoing.title: Ongoing Efforts
ongoing.text: Accessibility is an ongoing process. We continuously work to improve our site and address any issues that arise.

disclaimer.title: Disclaimer
disclaimer.text: The content of this website is provided for informational purposes. We make every effort to ensure accuracy but cannot guarantee that all information is complete or current. External links are provided for convenience; we are not responsible for the content of linked sites.
